alert.note: Alert for Albemarle (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 07 at 12:48AM EDT until July 07 at 2:15AM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING FOR NORTHWESTERN ALBEMARLE COUNTY... At 1248 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms produced between 2 and 3 inches of rain in the warned area. The heavy rain has ended, but it may take some time for water runoff to work down area streams. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Crozet... Free Union... Ivy... White Hall... Yancey Mills... Greenwood... FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
